alert.note: Alert for Chester; Decatur; Hardin; Henderson; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 4:02PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HENDERSON... NORTHERN MCNAIRY...NORTHWESTERN HARDIN...CENTRAL CHESTER AND SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM CST... At 402 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Masseyville, or 9 miles southeast of Chickasaw State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Adamsville, Sardis, Silerton, Masseyville, Reagan, Jacks Creek, Darden, Morris Chapel, Montgomery, Robertson, McNairy, Scotts Hill, Bethel Springs, Saltillo, Finger, Milledgeville, Enville, Forty Forks, and Rose Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west Tennessee.
